author: Amber Mcguckin
title: Manhunt underway for armed and dangerous suspect near Grand Forks, ND - Winnipeg | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 3, 2017 9:44 am Updated: February 3, 2017 11:52 am Manhunt underway for armed and dangerous suspect near Grand Forks, ND By Amber McGuckin Writer / Producer Global News 
The suspect of a manhunt in North Dakota has been identified as 23-year-old Daniel Michael TwoHearts. North Dakota Highway Patrol What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - 
A manhunt is underway near Grand Forks, North Dakota for a suspect who allegedly led officers on a high-speed chase, shot at police and stole a vehicle with a baby inside. 
The suspect is 23-year-old Daniel Michael TwoHearts, police said. 
It all started Thursday night around 9:30 when the North Dakota Highway Patrol tried to pull over a red Chevrolet truck with an excessively loud exhaust on highway I-29 at Grand Forks. 
The vehicle fled southbound. 
That’s when the suspect pulled out a gun and fired three shots at the trooper, according to the North Dakota Highway Patrol. 
The officer wasn’t hit. 
The suspect then fled on foot and two passengers in the truck were taken into custody. Methamphetamine was found inside the vehicle, police said. 
While officers were searching for the suspect, they received a call of a carjacking in Hillsboro with a baby in the vehicle just after 11 p.m. 
Police spotted the vehicle near Reynolds, ND and put out tire spikes again, flattening the tires of the vehicle. 
The suspect fled on foot again and the baby was found in the vehicle safe and uninjured. 
Numerous law enforcement agencies are continuing to look for the suspect Friday. 
TwoHearts is at large and considered armed and dangerous. © 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
